website_summaries.verdict: Packed full of stories, advice, and instructions designed to raise a happy and obedient puppy.
pros: Available in a variety of formats
Book uses real case stories to back up points and advice
Covers a wide range of puppy-training techniques, from early to late stages of development
Newly revised edition has more photos and additional chapters
cons: Long-form layout is clunky for quick reference

customer_reviews.title: Dogs are not wolves, and this is a guide to raising a wolf
customer_reviews.text: Totally based on misguided theories of dominance and wolf pack behavior. Dogs are not wolves anymore. We bought several puppy books to get different perspectives, and this has been the least useful.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Monks of New Skete - They know dogs!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a great book, with easy, smart training advice - ONLY positive reinforcement - get a book by the Monks of New Skete. There are so many helpful tips and tricks - in all of their books... and I'll leave you with the best one ever: Pooping on command! I will never have to stand in the rain again waiting for my dog to go potty! I've taught all my dogs this immediately and I have this book to thank!
customer_reviews.author: Bookapotamus

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I think I've read this book three times in my life so far. Great reminders for new puppy owners and existing dog owners a like. While I won't implement all their techniques, I do love the majority of their approaches...especially regarding early puppy development and intro training. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barkley

customer_reviews.title: I recommend reading this book before you get your puppy
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting a puppy, this book is the first thing you should get and keep. I pull it out with every puppy I get. It has a helpful chart in for when you first get your puppy. I recommend reading this book before you get your puppy. Then I recommend buying their training books also. I have used these books for many, many puppies and will continue to use and recommend to other people as well. This was a gift for someone else since my copy is old and worn. I get a puppy about every 5 years or so. Excellent choice for training and understanding.
customer_reviews.author: Keving

customer_reviews.title: The definitive guide to raising a pup
customer_reviews.text: The best guide to everything from selecting a pup, bringing it home, understanding the growth and developmental stages and most important, how to understand your dog in a way that maximizes your bond. I bought this on audible and found it so great that bought the hardcover edition to serve as a household reference.
customer_reviews.author: slyesa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Among the five puppy/dog books bought to get ready for a new puppy, this just may be the most informative. Not "slick" with lots of color pictures to tickle your fancy, but great information, most likely the best one of the five books. Don't get me wrong, like the ones that are slick too, but this book is just a "back to the basics" type of book, with great information. Great foundation to build upon when raising puppy.
customer_reviews.author: once burned

customer_reviews.title: Good read/Bad advice
customer_reviews.text: The first few chapters provide a background on your puppy's life at the breeder. Information here is a must read. Unfortunately (or rather fortunately for my puppy), I couldn't go through with the "correction" measures outline in the training areas. I tried it for one day and my puppy was not happy one bit. She's responding much better to the positive reinforcement approach used in Zak George's Dog Training Revolution (and is a much happier pup for it!). In summary, buy this book to read the first few chapters. Look for other ways to train your puppy that won't harm him or her.
customer_reviews.author: Ugly Duckling

customer_reviews.title: BEST book for new puppy parents
customer_reviews.text: I read/skimmed several puppy books before landing on this one. (This is the one my breeder recommended after I called her begging for help.) Not only does this book give you solid advice/direction for how to train your puppy on everything from house training to obedience, but they also give you background on what the breeder should be doing to get your puppy ready to go home. I'm glad I had such a great breeder and I feel confident she was doing everything needed to prep the puppies, but I would highly recommend this book for someone who is thinking about getting a dog and is interviewing breeders beforehand. You'll learn so much!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: So very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful book for someone who wants to understand what is going on and then how to cope. I was able to visit my breeder regularly before picking up my puppy and it was interesting to see that the pups were behaving exactly as described as they were being weaned. Once home, you have to figure out what works best in your context but that is where the book is so good because it explains what is going on. This was definitely the best book for me.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Complete Palaver! Aka worthless
customer_reviews.text: The picture attached: why is potty training not in the index? Really?? If you want to get to the heart of the problem be prepared to read a bunch of worthless information to find what you’re looking for. Everything is told in story form. There is no such thing as bullet points or quick looks to figure out how to solve this problem our that. Whoever wrote this worthless book was looking to win the Nobel prize in literature and they just may have done so.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Focus on the Practical and the Real
customer_reviews.text: The Monks of New Skete approach and concepts have been around for awhile. In this day and age of everyone and their Dog Training concepts and ideas that usually take the position that Dogs need to be treated like people. Dogs are better than that and this book is a great start as it focuses on Puppies and how to get them off on the right start. With a Military and Law Enforcement background in K9 Handling and as an owner of a large Dog Kennel I can't stress enough the need to respect dogs by understanding how they perceive the world.
customer_reviews.author: david Torres

customer_reviews.title: An old standard that's been aged out.
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars as there's something from all experiences. In this case, it was reinforcement of what not to think or do and to follow the evidence-based training approaches. Old perspectives on relating or training a dog. Many of the techniques and views of the Monks have been discredited by science. What one was a classic is now NOT appropriate. I picked up the Monk's books to look at a new perspective towards training dogs. A good trainer is always learning. I put these books on eBay before finishing the first chapter, after giving the a good skimming. If we still had brick-n-morter book stores, these would have made it off the shelves. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: BGinCA

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! I got my first puppy after the kids were grown up. I wish I had it for their dogs. My puppy was potty trained within 5 days (I also used bells on the door to go outside). I couldn't believe how grounded and peaceful be became with his crate. Months later he goes to his crate when he is ready to sleep. It isn't the punishment that I had been lead to believe it would be. He knows his schedule, although I follow it more loosely now. And he is potty trained! As long as I hear those bells ring he potties outside and that started on day 5!
customer_reviews.author: newcreation

customer_reviews.title: Long, dense read
customer_reviews.text: So. Many. Words. If you want to read a novel about dog training, have lots of free time, and are weeks away from bringing home a puppy, this book is for you. If on the other hand your puppy is already home (or you don’t have hours in the day to read about training), or you just want some quick background and tips, run away. Candidly I only made it through the first 40 or so pages before giving up and turning to a reference book that was more readable and, well, practical, so I gave two stars in case at page 41 the book miraculously did a 180 and became riveting.
customer_reviews.author: P Elias

customer_reviews.title: Outdated domination techniques
customer_reviews.text: Some of the information on how puppies grow and develop is useful. However, the training portion of the book advocates using force, domination techniques, and fear. These are outdated methods and positive reinforcement is not only very useful, but much more human.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Most important book when you get a new puppy!
customer_reviews.text: I used the techniques in this book with our goldendoodle, Buster, over 10 years ago, and he turned out to be the sweetest, most well-behaved dog any of my friends and family knew (he passed recently). I got this book for a friend and she is also loving it (her puppy has not yet arrived). If you (and the rest of your pack) follow these guidelines, I think you will have great results too!
customer_reviews.author: M. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Training Book part 2
customer_reviews.text: Best puppy training book I've ever gotten! I first purchased it over 30 years ago after reading the sister book "How to be Your Dog's Best Friend" (which I also highly recommend). When I found it had a digital version, I had to add it to my digital library. I consider the two books by the monks of New Skete to be essential dog owner books. They really emphasize that what you have with your dog is a relationship and relating in a way the dog can understand.
customer_reviews.author: Father0fnine

customer_reviews.title: The best dog training/dog raising book EVER
customer_reviews.text: We used this book to train our German Shepherd. She is the best dog we've ever had. She's extremely obedient, and the things we learned from this book, we still use today. My parents got a puppy, so I sent them this book. The Art of Raising a Puppy by the Monks of New Skete, the only book I would use to train a lifelong companion.
customer_reviews.author: FBODYWS6

customer_reviews.title: A must have book for all puppy owners .
customer_reviews.text: This book taught me so much about my puppy. Understanding the way puppies think will allow you to have an incredible connection with your puppy. Don't be discourage by the German Shepherd. I have a Goldendoodle and everything they say applies to my puppy. I bought other books specific to Goldendoodles and they were terrible. This book has such a caring way to raise a puppy. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A total rip off!
customer_reviews.text: The post on amazon showed a different cover and a different publication date (2011) date from what I got! So now I have a 1991 version - which I already have - and no updated new version at all. Feel totally ripped off!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Second time to read this
customer_reviews.text: We bought our 2nd Dalmatian in 1988 and learned so much from reading this book. In 2018, 18 years after our sweet Dal died, we decided to get another Dalmatian puppy. I found The Art of Raising a Puppy online, and have reread the revised edition. Once again, it’s been such a great help! Thanks, Monks of New Skete, for your wise advice in “The Art of Raising a Puppy”.
customer_reviews.author: VaBluebird

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Best book. I recommend this to anyone who is thinking about getting a puppy. It gives you so much insight into the inner workings and mind/ life of dogs! It also helps with timelines and training and what to do when you bring the puppy home. Basically it left me with no questions. This was recommended by my trainer who uses the Koehler method of training.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: The happiness of raising a puppy
customer_reviews.text: When we adopted our golden retriever the breeder recommended this book. We read it at that time and read it again when puppy was seven months old. Great reading, we learned so much. We loved that it speaks about the happiness of raising a puppy, which is not easy but it is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: AdrianN

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely GREAT read...
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely GREAT read for anyone curious about a new pup and beyond just that. Within the texts are enlightening storiea and perceptions on Man's Best Friend. I greatly enjoyed the honesty and experience the Monks of New Skete packed into this book. Looking forward to reading this book many more times, fore I'm sure I missed something!
customer_reviews.author: FoxyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The classic book and all you need to know about the first several months with you new puppy. The best! Needed a refresher before new puppy arrived in the house and The Art of Raising a Puppy is the best place to begin your life with a new puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A compassionate yet firm approach to training a pup
customer_reviews.text: The book is anchored in the monks love for the dogs they raise and train. Their methods reflect a compassionate approach to the dog's developmental stage; wisdom compiled through years of research and actual experience with their German Shepherds; awareness of the dogs canine nature and its behavioral and social implications and respect for life. It's a great read even if you aren't raising a pup!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ann

customer_reviews.title: THE way to start out training your puppy
customer_reviews.text: They have it figured out, if you read their book...follow their training program...you will turn out a well rounded and trained puppy ready to obtain training titles in whatever venue your looking to get into. Start with the aptitude test in the back when picking out your pup, make sure that's the kind of dog your looking for....and then have some challenging fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Something for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my best friend who is s dog lover and expert. She just got a new puppy and, although she is very experienced with training dogs and puppies, she said she found this book helpful and taught her things even SHE didn't know. A very thorough and well-organized book for the novice dog trainer to the most experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great In-Depth Book on Raising Puppies
customer_reviews.text: Great true story with in-depth information on raising puppies. I found it useful in understanding and helping my adult rescue dog try to overcome some of her issues.
customer_reviews.author: FancyJ

customer_reviews.title: Deceitful representation
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be the “revised” edition published in 2011 but it was the original 1991 version, without a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Romano

customer_reviews.title: Best book on puppy raising
customer_reviews.text: I have raised and trained several dogs in my life, with varying degrees of success. This book fills in what has been missing in those relationships and calls me to up my game with my next puppy. I would recommend this book to anyone who has or will be getting a puppy with which they desire companionship and not just ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Nibor D.

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book with high expectations and was pretty disappointed. The book seems to be written for a very specific type of audience that is 1) adopting from a breeder and 2) lives in a big house with a backyard. I live in NYC and am adopting from a shelter. I was hoping for tips on puppy training in general, and didn’t find this to be too helpful. Online research has been better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Vargas

customer_reviews.title: This is the #1 gsd training book you must have.
customer_reviews.text: An important book to GSD owners and all dog owners. Simple and advanced methods to taking control of your pup and his training. There's not another like it, seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Joanncolorado18

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: This book covers every aspect of puppyhood and how to be a good pet parent, pack leader to your puppy. It has pictures in parts of the book which is very helpful. I think it covers every aspect that you could think of. It was recommended to me by someone else and I am glad that I took the suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Even if you think you know how to raise a puppy, this book is full of valuable advice!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I knew how to raise a puppy but my newest dog proved to be a real challenge with house training and recall. This book changed my thought process and helped me learn a new way to teach my puppy, with huge improvement in her behavior. I'd recommend to anyone with a new puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Good insight into your dogs developmental world
customer_reviews.text: REALLY good book with great training advice, but man it's a lot to read when you just need a quick reference on how to (insert training need here). This would be a great book for someone planning to get a dog or puppy - really doesn't matter because you CAN teach an old dog new tricks. The psychological development of a puppy is really interesting reading and helpful when dealing with our now 9 month old terrier. Were it more of a training reference book and less of a philosophy and psychology book I probably would have given more stars. Definitely worth the read.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This was a beautifully written book. Highly recommend for any dog owner. This would have been interesting even if I weren’t getting a puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful but wish it were more concise
customer_reviews.text: Encyclopedic....but do you need encyclopedic to train a dog? I'm of two minds. On the one hand, I was always able to find helpful advice when I needed it. On the other hand: it was daunting to read the entire book during training, and that might have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Frommer

customer_reviews.title: Good information and step-by-step training process.
customer_reviews.text: This book was recommended by the breeder of my dog. It went stage by stage from puppy to adult. It also poo-poos old fashioned ideas we have grown up with about how to housebreak, etc.( i.e. not punishing for what is a natural instinct).
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome puppy info.
customer_reviews.text: This book is well written and has great and sound ways to pick out your puppy all the way to training. I thought I knew a lot about dogs and dog training. This book showe me I still had more to learn. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Wishebone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, comprehensive review for raising a happy and well behaved pup
customer_reviews.text: I've had dogs my whole life but it had been a while since I had a puppy. This book was an excellent reminder of what is needed to get your new puppy started, on her/his new life, with your family, on the right foot.
customer_reviews.author: D. English

customer_reviews.title: It's very helpful - IF you have the patience to read it.
customer_reviews.text: This book was instrumental in me - (I've always said I didn't want a dog) - learning enough to better understand how dogs view the world, how they think, and how to better communicate with them. It's DETAILED. Probably too much so for most people. But it's very helpful. If you are thinking about getting a puppy - do them and yourself a favor and read this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sparty76BC

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for understanding your dog.
customer_reviews.text: Great book for my husband and I raising our first puppy. We were recommended by the breeder or our dog to read this book, and it was well worth the time and expense to understand her behavior and what to do and not do for discipline. I would recommend this book highly.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great book for new dog owners.
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Kind of a bit long in birthing stages. If your getting your puppy and not breeding you don't need it. Read if your interested. The rest is great information. Some of it was a refresh other parts were a tweek but a few really interesting things that really help. If you take the time and do the work, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a great book. It is easy and enjoyable to read ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, I think this is a great book. It is easy and enjoyable to read and makes sense. That said, we do not yet have our puppy, so I guess the real review will come in a few months! But by reading up to where I am now, I already feel far better mentally prepared for my puppy's arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Lolaloo

customer_reviews.title: Learning to raise a puppy in a compassionate way
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've read this book, having read it first many years ago when it came out and I had a new Airedale puppy. Now some 20 years later what struck me was not the passages about raising my new puppy to be the best companion, but "raising" myself to recognize, in the reactions to my dog's behavior, those things that I must change within my own psyche.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy N.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent read in preparation for getting a puppy
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two GSD's last November and the breeder that we got them from said that this was requires reading before we could pick them up! Very valuable information for any new puppy owner!
customer_reviews.author: Crazybutterflylady

customer_reviews.title: you'll end up with a fine companion. Our Jack Russell-Queensland heeler rescue had some ...
customer_reviews.text: I've given this book to people and have seen that if you follow their advice with most dogs, you'll end up with a fine companion. Our Jack Russell-Queensland heeler rescue had some serious issues that this book alone couldn't address. However, because we started with their puppy foundation, our work with a one-on-one trainer progressed quickly and easily and we have a wonderful canine companion now. Our trainer was impressed by how advanced our pup's basic obedience was thanks to these techniques. Our second dog is much easier going and these techniques worked fine on her without any need for extra-special training.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!  Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is written for the individual who is serious about learning as much as possible about training a balanced, well behaved, canine companion. It is not a quick read. There is much to much important information to LEARN, to quickly read through this book. It contains tips for older pups and adults as well. It is well written, the authors are knowledgeable, and have thirty years of experience applying and refining their methods. I know......sounds heavy and technical but it's NOT. Enjoyable read!
customer_reviews.author: GlendaV

customer_reviews.title: A Deeper Understanding
customer_reviews.text: What a remarkable book. Here is a big thanks to the other reviewers whose comments led me to this wonderful collection of suggestions on raising a puppy. While I've been around dogs all my life, and experienced the joy of raising several well behaved dogs, I learned a lot from this book. It filled many gaps in my understanding of what pups experience before they are made family members, and expanded upon how those early days impact behavior. Of particular value was the peaceful manner in which lessons from wolves should influence training. I agree with others who have commented that this is a must read for dog lovers.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. I highly recommend it. I purchased this as I had lost my old copy. I have raised five dogs on this method. All were well behaved members of my family and community. They were all house broken so easily, not one longer than a week. It's a practical guide that makes a lot of sense. You can really train your puppy at home with this book, but don't forget to get your pup out as much as possible and socialize it in a busy area and you will be happy on both counts. I have had three Dobermans, a Weimaraner and a French Bulldog all great with children and adults. Can't recommend this book enough.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: A must read for new puppy owners
customer_reviews.text: A breed club whose show I attended highly recommended this book. It explains in detail, the process of breeding/whelping and socializing a healthy puppy and then how to properly train that puppy. This book is very comprehensive and informative. I am preparing to bring a new puppy into my home and this book has been extremely helpful. I have learned training tips that I wish I had known with my first dog.
customer_reviews.author: kr

customer_reviews.title: Must read for new puppy owners
customer_reviews.text: If you have never owned a puppy before and have one now or are getting one - then you NEED to read this book. If you have had a puppy before but need a refresher or want to do “better” this time around, I would recommend this book as well.
customer_reviews.author: Winter

customer_reviews.title: A definite must-read for new puppy parents!
customer_reviews.text: I never owned a dog before our mini golden doodle came to us last year, so I bought this book and read it and used its guidance. I have no doubt one year later that because of some of the practices this book suggests, our dog is one of the most well-behaved dogs I know. He does not bark incessently at other dogs or pull on his leash. He is quiet for the most part and listens the majority of the time. I often think back to before we had our puppy and how this book helped us become good dog parents. Give it a try, especially if you have never owned a dog before.
customer_reviews.author: Katie J

customer_reviews.title: buy this book
customer_reviews.text: you will find out all of the things one does wrong in raising a puppy . goes in depth of how the puppy has no idea what you are talking about . basic understanding of getting your dog to be a great dog
customer_reviews.author: yazbik

customer_reviews.title: A must have for potential puppy owners.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, informative book for a person who is new to raising a puppy and wants to end up with an obedient dog. It is full of information about every phase of a puppies life. We bought this book just prior to getting our first dog. We read and re-read the book gleaning as much information as we could, and then returned to various sections as we encountered problems with our puppy. This book, along with Don Sullivan's Perfect Dog videos are a must have for the potential dog owner. Rather than trying to figure it out yourself, learn from those who have mastered the raising of dogs.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Full of information, but not didactic
customer_reviews.text: Years of breeding and training have lead to a most usable text. It rates as my favorite self-improvement book. Too much to absorb with one reading so it becomes a source for suggestions along the many-years trip with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great book for anyone that recently got or is considering ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book for anyone that recently got or is considering getting a puppy. It's more than just a guide on how to train your puppy. The author takes time up front explaining how the mother dog takes care of the pups (and disciplines) from the time they are born and suggestions on how we as humans can continue that training. He covers topics such as instinct so you really understand common behaviors and why a dog does something. I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. It is different than traditional dog training books.
customer_reviews.author: md22

customer_reviews.title: Best Puppy Book Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best puppy book ever. I wish more people read this before getting a dog! Tons of useful information and it will make you a better dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: michael guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book, so informative and written with the love and compassion of someone who is in tune with their furry loved ones! I found it to be very helpful training our most recent pup
customer_reviews.author: Vj

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fascinating insights & approaches to rearing good citizen canines
customer_reviews.text: Peek into a fascinating, behind the scenes exploration of the philosophy & strategies successfully used by the Monks in acclaimed German Shepherd rearing & training.

customer_reviews.title: Good read but not actionable enough
customer_reviews.text: The book was an engaging look into the lives of an interesting community of monks, but I didn't get actionable advice from it for my rescue dog.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Bee

customer_reviews.title: So good I got two copies.
customer_reviews.text: My son had this book years ago and found it to be an informative and gentle way to train a puppy. I bought myself a copy. Found out he lost his copy so I turned around and bought him a new copy too.
customer_reviews.author: Reney

customer_reviews.title: Raise your pup to be a friendly, obedient German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: Afghan Hounds are just about at the bottom of the list in trainability. But that's because they're smart, and most people are content to just let them be beautiful. We had rescue Afghans since the early '60's, and finally started with an Afghan puppy. The Monks of New Skete are right on, in understanding the dogs' needs, and how the dog fits into your 'pack'. Zack took to being a German Shepherd, was a loving companion, a protector of us, and obeyed voice commands and hand gestures immediately. He regularly came first in obedience trials, and without 'The Art Of Raising A Puppy', it wouldn't have happened.
customer_reviews.author: MDI Chef

customer_reviews.title: The encyclopedia of dog training
customer_reviews.text: We were going to use a combination of Dr. Dunbar & The Dog Whisperer. It turns out it is this book! It’s LONG but thorough. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nascar Runner

customer_reviews.title: I formation you can use with your dog.
customer_reviews.text: I learned a lot about dogs in general. Since I have a puppy I am reading as I go. Lots of good information even though I have a little dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great book to read before you bring a puppy home!
customer_reviews.text: It's a thoughtfully written and informative book. It explains so much--a must if you want to bring a dog into your family, especially if you are not an experienced dog owner. It has clear steps to helping puppy develop into a well-adjusted dog.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Bill

customer_reviews.title: Cringe Worthy
customer_reviews.text: This is 100% dominance training. Not my style. The book was recommended to me but I won't be finishing it due to my preference for positive training.
customer_reviews.author: CassG

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Very long with little information. Better get a condensed book as this one is exhausting to read ... .... ....
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very informative, great overall information
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid most puppy books would either be aimed at being very strict or being too nice, this book was the perfect mix. These monks out in New York breed and raise German Shepherds but the information is geared toward owners of all dogs. They discuss many of the things you need to consider before getting a dog, some were definitely things I'd never thought of. customer_reviews.title: Excellent book with clear advice
customer_reviews.text: This book gives wonderful advice on how to raise a happy, healthy dog. Your dog just wants to be with you and please you, and this book helps you learn how to understand your new puppy. I first read this in the 1990's, and think this is still the best puppy book overall. The authors are not fans of "Crating", i.e., caging your dog up for long periods. Dogs need to be with you - sleep in your room, smell your breath, be part of your pack. A dog that has proper excercise, feeding, healthcare, and love will become part of your family. So please don't cage your new "baby"!
